Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN TcpServerSocket::Accept (  TcpSocket &  socket,
InetSocketAddr *  peer_addr = 0
) 
 

Accepts a pending connection request. If the method succeeds, then socket is initialized and ready for communication. If addr is given, then it is set to the address of the peer.

Parameters:
socket Socket of accepted connection.
peer_addr Socket address of peer.

BOOLEAN TcpServerSocket::HandOver (  TcpServerSocket &  to_socket  )  [inline]
 

Hands over itself to to_socket. This socket is then reverted to closed state and hence does not operate any more. Instead, to_socket continues operation. This method should only be used to hand over a socket between execution contexts if needed. Note that if you hand over a socket from one execution context to another, also the execution context to which to_socket belongs must have initialized a socket handler. For the hand over to succeed this socket must be in open state and to_socket must be in closed state. If the hand over can not be performed FALSE is returned.

See also:
ExecutionContext

SocketHandler

Returns:
Success of hand over.

BOOLEAN TcpServerSocket::Listen (  INT  backlog = c_default_max_pending_requests  ) 
 

Puts the server socket into listen state. When the socket is in listen state and a connection request is coming in, then the event c_event_conn_req_pending is triggered.

Parameters:
backlog Maximum number of pending connection requests.

void TcpServerSocket::OnControlMsg (  const SocketControlMsg &  msg  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Translates the socket control message msg into a socket event and routes it accordingly. If a listener is set, its OnSocketEvent method is called. Otherwise the messages are discarded.

Implements InetSocket.

BOOLEAN TcpServerSocket::Open (  const InetSocketAddr &  local_addr,
BOOLEAN  may_reuse_addr = TRUE
) 
 

Opens a TCP server type socket.

Parameters:
local_addr Mandatory local address to bind server socket to.
may_reuse_addr Local address may be bound by multiple sockets.
